required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of GS-9674 in Adults With Normal and Impaired Hepatic Function
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Open-Label, Parallel-Group, Adaptive, Single-Dose Study to Evaluate the Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of GS-9674 in Subjects With Normal and Impaired Hepatic Function

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to evaluate the single-dose pharmacokinetics of GS-9674 in adults with impaired hepatic function relative to matched, healthy controls with normal hepatic function.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 96 hours postdose
primary_outcome.description: AUClast is defined as the concentration of drug from time zero to the last observable concentration.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 96 hours postdose
primary_outcome.description: AUCinf is defined as the concentration of drug extrapolated to infinite time.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 96 hours postdose
primary_outcome.description: Cmax is defined as the maximum concentration of drug.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 96 hours postdose
primary_outcome.description: %AUCexp is defined as the percentage of area under the curve (AUC) extrapolated between AUClast and AUCinf.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 96 hours postdose
primary_outcome.description: Clast is defined as the last observable concentration of drug.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 96 hours postdose
primary_outcome.description: Tmax is defined as the time (observed time point) of Cmax.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 96 hours postdose
primary_outcome.description: Tlast is defined as the time (observed time point) of Clast.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 96 hours postdose
primary_outcome.description: λz is defined as the terminal elimination rate constant, estimated by linear regression of the terminal elimination phase of the log plasma concentration of drug versus time curve of the drug.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 96 hours postdose
primary_outcome.description: CL/F is defined as the apparent oral clearance following administration of the drug.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 96 hours postdose
primary_outcome.description: Vz/F is defined as the apparent volume of distribution of the drug.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 96 hours postdose
primary_outcome.description: t1/2 is defined as the estimate of the terminal elimination half-life of the drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from Baseline in Pharmacodynamic (PD) Markers such as FGF19 and C4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 96 hours postdose

arm_group.description: Participants with mild hepatic impairment and matched healthy controls will receive a single dose of GS-9674 (30 mg) on Day 1.
Participants with moderate hepatic impairment and matched healthy controls will receive a single dose of GS-9674 (30 mg) on Day 1.
Participants with severe hepatic impairment and matched healthy controls will receive a single dose of GS-9674 (10 mg) on Day 1.

intervention.description: GS-9674 30 mg (3 x 10 mg tablet) orally
GS-9674 10 mg (1 x 10 mg tablet) orally

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
Cohort 1:
- Individuals with mildly impaired and normal hepatic function.
- Individuals with mild hepatic impairment must have a score of 5-6 on the CPT Classification at Screening without evidence of worsening clinical and/or laboratory signs of hepatic impairment within 2 months prior or within the screening period.
Cohort 2:
- Individuals with moderately impaired and normal hepatic function.
- Individuals with moderate hepatic impairment must have a score of 7-9 on the CPT Classification at Screening without evidence of worsening clinical and/or laboratory signs of hepatic impairment within 2 months prior or within the screening period.
Cohort 3:
- Individuals with severely impaired and normal hepatic function.
- Individuals with severe hepatic impairment must have a score of 10-15 on the CPT Classification at Screening without evidence of worsening clinical and/or laboratory signs of hepatic impairment within 2 months prior or within the screening period.
Note: Other protocol defined Inclusion/Exclusion criteria may apply.
